problem_text:
Suppose that G is a finite solvable group, A ⩽ Aut G, CG(A) = 1, the orders of G and A are coprime, and let l(A) be the length of the longest chain of nested subgroups of A. Is the Fitting height of G bounded above by l(A)?
For A solvable the question coincides with 5.30. It is proved that for any finite group A, first, there exist G with h(G) = l(A) and, second, there is a finite set of primes π (depending on A) such that if |G| is coprime to each prime in π, then h(G) ⩽ l(A). See (A. Turull, Math. Z., 187 (1984), 491–503).
A. Turull
